intro: Topobea steyermarkii, commonly known as the Mexican moonseed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruit is a fleshy, orange-red berry that contains several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
